item.title: Trench developing across the width of the road. Causes vehicles to jolt severely, 18th December
item.description:
Just before Springwell Gardens on Parton road. Stretches the full road width but is worse on the uphill side.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous for cyclists use of curb edging stones to mark circles on new roundabout, 18th December
item.description:
Pavement curb stones are super slippery and dangerous for cyclists especially if they are raised On this new roundabout it is hard to spot that the circles arent just white lines even in the daytime At night they are invisible and very dangerous I fell off my cycle on this in the dark and really hurt myself (nearly broke my shoulder plus several other things) and damaged my bike plus expensive cycle clothing. It has taken days for me to feel better but I still have a very sore shoulder. It will cost me around Â£100 to repair my bike and replace the clothes. I will post these photos on all the cycle groups I can find to help reduce the inevitable number of casualties I can see its ok for cars to drive over the inner circles, but cyclists wont see them or clock that they arent just white lines so something needs to be changed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
